Type.Name: File
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Provides information and performs operations on files .

remarks.para: Implementations of this class are required to preserve the case of path strings. Implementations are required to be case sensitive if and only if the platform is case-sensitive.
The following table describes the enumerations that are used to customize the behavior of various methods.

item.description: Specifies read and write access to a file.
Specifies the level of access permitted for a file that is already in use.
Specifies whether the contents of an existing file are preserved or overwritten, and whether requests to create an existing file cause an exception.

.method public hidebysig static class System.IO.StreamWriter AppendText(string path)
public static System.IO.StreamWriter AppendText (string path);

Docs.param: A containing the name of the file to append to.

summary.para: Appends UTF-8 encoded text to an existing file.

returns.para: A that appends UTF-8 encoded text to the specified file.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to (, ). If the file specified by does not exist, it is created. If the file does exist, writes to the append text to the file. Additional threads are permitted to read the file while it is open.

The argument is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. To obtain the current working directory, see .

Docs.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

Docs.permission: Requires permission to write to the specified file. See .
Docs.exception: A general I/O exception occurred, such as trying to access a CD-ROM drive whose tray is open.
is in an implementation-specific invalid format.
Access is denied. The caller does not have the required permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig static class System.IO.FileStream Create(string path)
public static System.IO.FileStream Create (string path);

Docs.param: A containing the name of the file.

summary.para: Creates or overwrites the specified file.

returns.para: A that provides read/write access to the specified file.

remarks.para: If the specified file does not exist, it is created; if it does exist and it is not read-only, the contents are overwritten.

The argument is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. To obtain the current working directory, see .

Docs.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

exception.para: is a zero-length string, contains only white space, or contains one or more implementation-specific invalid characters.

The directory information specified in was not found.
An I/O error occurred while creating the file.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The length of or the absolute path information for exceeds the system-defined maximum length.
Docs.permission: Requires permission to write the specified file. See .

The argument is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. To obtain the current working directory, see .

.method public hidebysig static bool Exists(string path)
public static bool Exists (string path);

Docs.param: A containing the name of the file to check.

summary.para: Returns a indicating whether the specified file exists.

returns.para: if the caller has the required permissions and contains the name of an existing file; otherwise, . If is or a zero-length string, returns .

remarks.para: If the caller does not have sufficient permissions to read the specified file, no exception is thrown and the method returns regardless of the existence of .

The argument is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. To obtain the current working directory, see .

summary.para: Returns the creation date and time of the specified file or directory.

returns.para: A structure set to the creation date and time for the specified file or directory. This value is expressed in local time.
Platforms that do not support this feature return .

Docs.param: A containing the name of the file for which to set the creation date and time information.
A containing the value to set for the creation date and time of . This value is expressed in local time.

summary.para: Sets the creation date and time for the specified file.

remarks.para: The argument is permitted to specify relative or absolute path information. Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. To obtain the current working directory, see .
On platforms that do not support this feature, this method has no effect. If this feature is supported, the range of dates that is valid for this operation is implementation-specific.
